    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static WZTextManager getInstance()
        Use this method to access the GoCoder SDK Text Manager
        Returns:
        The GoCoder SDK Text Manager

      • init

        public void init(Context context)
        Initialize the text manager by providing the application context. This is called during SDK initialization and it is not necessary for client app code to call
        Parameters:
        context - The app context

      • release

        public void release()
        Release the resources used by the text manager

      • loadFont

        public UUID loadFont(String file,
                     int size,
                     int padX,
                     int padY)
        This will load the specified font file, create a texture for the defined character range, and setup all required values used to render with it.
        Parameters:
        file - Filename of the font (.ttf, .otf) to use. In 'Assets' folder.
        size - Requested pixel size of font (height)
        padX - Extra padding per character (X Axis); to prevent overlapping characters.
        padY - Extra padding per character (Y Axis); to prevent overlapping characters.

      • getFontById

        public WZTextManager.Font getFontById(UUID fontId)
        Returns the font for the specified id
        Parameters:
        fontId - The id for the font to return
        Returns:
        The font for the specified id, null if a font with that id does not exist

      • createTextObject

        public WZText createTextObject(UUID fontId)
        Create a new, empty text object to be drawn using the font with the specified id
        Parameters:
        fontId - The id for the font to be used for this text object
        Returns:
        A new text object, null if the font id specified is invalid

      • createTextObject

        public WZText createTextObject(UUID fontId,
                               String text)
        Create a new text object using the specified string to be drawn using the font with the specified id
        Parameters:
        fontId - The id for the font to be used for this text object
        text - The text string to draw
        Returns:
        A new text object, null if the font id specified is invalid

      • createTextObject

        public WZText createTextObject(UUID fontId,
                               String text,
                               WZColor color)
        Create a new text object using the specified font, text string, and color
        Parameters:
        fontId - The id for the font to be used for this text object
        text - The text string to draw
        color - The text color
        Returns:
        A new text object, null if the font id specified is invalid

      • createTextObject

        public WZText createTextObject(UUID fontId,
                               String text,
                               float r,
                               float g,
                               float b,
                               float a)
        Create a new text object using the specified font, text string, and color
        Parameters:
        fontId - The id for the font to be used for this text object
        text - The text string to draw
        r - The red component of the text color (0.0 - 1.0)
        g - The green component of the text color (0.0 - 1.0)
        b - The blue component of the text color (0.0 - 1.0)
        a - The alpha component of the text color (0.0 - 1.0)
        Returns:
        A new text object, null if the font id specified is invalid

      • createTextObject

        public WZText createTextObject(UUID fontId,
                               String text,
                               float r,
                               float g,
                               float b)
        Create a new text object using the specified font, text string, and color
        Parameters:
        fontId - The id for the font to be used for this text object
        text - The text string to draw
        r - The red component of the text color (0.0 - 1.0)
        g - The green component of the text color (0.0 - 1.0)
        b - The blue component of the text color (0.0 - 1.0)
        Returns:
        A new text object, null if the font id specified is invalid

        Parameters:

        Indicates if text object rendering is enabled or not
        Returns:

      • isWZVideoFrameRendererActive

        public boolean isWZVideoFrameRendererActive()
        Description copied from interface: WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer
        Indicates if the frame renderer is active or not WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer.onWZVideoFrameRendererDraw(WZGLES.EglEnv, WZSize, int) will only be called on an active renderer
        Specified by:
        isWZVideoFrameRendererActive in interface WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer
        Returns:
        true is this renderer is active, false otherwise.

      • onWZVideoFrameRendererInit

        public void onWZVideoFrameRendererInit(WZGLES.EglEnv eglEnv)
        Description copied from interface: WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer
        Called at the beginning of a rendering cycle
        Specified by:
        onWZVideoFrameRendererInit in interface WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer
        Parameters:
        eglEnv - The current OpenGL ES environment. Note that this may be a different EglEnv than the one supplied with each call to WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer.onWZVideoFrameRendererDraw(WZGLES.EglEnv, WZSize, int). See for WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer.onWZVideoFrameRendererDraw(WZGLES.EglEnv, WZSize, int) for details.

      • onWZVideoFrameRendererDraw

        public void onWZVideoFrameRendererDraw(WZGLES.EglEnv eglEnv,
                                       WZSize frameSize,
                                       int frameRotation)
        Description copied from interface: WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer
        Called to render a frame of video to the viewport for the current OpenGL ES context Note that eglEnv may differ at each call. You can assume, however, that the EGL context in each instance in between calls to WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer.onWZVideoFrameRendererInit(WZGLES.EglEnv) and WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer.onWZVideoFrameRendererRelease(WZGLES.EglEnv eglEnv) are shared contexts and can access the same EGL resources.
        Specified by:
        onWZVideoFrameRendererDraw in interface WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer
        Parameters:
        eglEnv - The current OpenGL ES environment. Note that this may be a different EglEnv than the one supplied with
        frameSize - size of the video frame (pixels)
        frameRotation - frameRotation angle to apply when rendering (degrees, usually 0)

      • onWZVideoFrameRendererRelease

        public void onWZVideoFrameRendererRelease(WZGLES.EglEnv eglEnv)
        Description copied from interface: WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer
        Called at the end of a rendering cycle
        Specified by:
        onWZVideoFrameRendererRelease in interface WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer
        Parameters:
        eglEnv - The current OpenGL ES environment.
